meanings.sent1: The fish were spawning in the river, laying their eggs.
meanings.sent2: Salmon typically spawn in freshwater before migrating to the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The chickens were spawning eggs faster than we could collect them!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were spawning new innovations in the field of technology.
meanings.sent5: The garden was alive with the colorful flowers spawning in the spring.

meanings.definition: To give rise to or generate
meanings.sent1: His success in the competition spawned a newfound confidence in him.
meanings.sent2: The new movie spawned a whole series of sequels.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain spawned a spontaneous dance party in the street.
meanings.sent4: The small business spawned a community of loyal customers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement spawned a love for reading in the students.

meanings.definition: To bring forth or produce in large quantities
meanings.sent1: The warm weather spawned a bumper crop of fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The factory was spawning new products every month.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes spawned laughter that echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: The artist's creativity spawned a collection of beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent5: The busy season spawned a flurry of activity in the store.
